section: A. Recipient wishes to engage the Vendor to provide certain services and resources (the "Deliverables") and Provider desires to provide Recipient with the Services all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
explanation: The Recitals section refers to the Provider as both 'Vendor' and 'Provider'. Using two different terms interchangeably for the same party without clear definition creates potential confusion and ambiguity about which entity is being referred to in specific instances.

section: 3.1 Termination of Agreement. This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The sentence is structurally flawed and does not make sense. It includes repetitive and unnecessary text ('Agreement') and lacks clarity in its overall construction.

section: Each of the Recipient and the Provider may, in their sole discretion, terminate this Agreement in whole or in part, at any time without cause, and without liability except, in the case of the Recipient, for required payment for services rendered and reimbursement for authorized expenses incurred, by providing at least 90 (ninety) days' prior written notice to the other party (such date, the "Services Termination Date").
explanation: This section allows both the Recipient and the Provider to terminate the agreement without cause by providing 90 days prior written notice. However, it states that the Recipient has to pay for services rendered and expenses incurred, but it is not clear if the Provider has to do the same. It is not structurally correct because it creates an ambiguity.
